meanings.definition: To destroy completely; put an end to.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight set out to eradicate the dragon terrorizing the village.
meanings.sent2: The government launched a campaign to eradicate poverty in the country.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to eradicate all evil from the city.
meanings.sent4: The powerful medicine was able to eradicate the virus from the patient's body.
meanings.sent5: The farmer used pesticides to eradicate the pests destroying his crops.

meanings.sent1: The superhero's laser beams could eradicate any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to eradicate all traces of the outdated software.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand had the power to eradicate any mistakes during his performance.
meanings.sent4: The flood threatened to eradicate the entire town from the map.
meanings.sent5: The detective was determined to eradicate all doubts about the suspect's alibi.

meanings.definition: To remove or get rid of completely.
meanings.sent1: The new vacuum cleaner was able to eradicate even the tiniest dust particles.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to eradicate all traces of nuts from the dish due to allergies.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's red pen could eradicate any errors in the students' essays.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat was enough to eradicate all snow from the driveway.
meanings.sent5: The expert cleaner knew how to eradicate stubborn stains from the carpet.
